title: Welcome to Basalt University
content:
# Welcome to Basalt University

## Purpose
Basalt University is your central hub for all Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), training modules, and internal guides. Whether you are an administrator, content editor, or operations manager, this knowledge base will help you navigate and utilize the full power of BasaltCMS.

## Navigation
- **General**: High-level overviews and company policies.
- **CMS Editing**: Guides on using the content editor, managing blogs, and pages.
- **Technical**: Advanced configuration and troubleshooting.
- **Vendor Ops**: Managing vendor compliance, onboarding, and documents.

## Getting Help
If you cannot find what you are looking for, please contact the IT support team or raise a ticket in the Support portal.

title: Using the Visual Content Editor
content:
# Using the Visual Content Editor

## Overview
The BasaltCMS Visual Editor allows you to create stunning landing pages and articles without writing a single line of code. It uses a drag-and-drop interface powered by the **Puck** editor.

## Getting Started
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Landing Pages** or **CMS > Blog**.
2.  Click **Create New** or select an existing item to edit.
3.  Click the **"Edit Visual"** button to launch the Puck editor.

## Editor Layout
- **Left Panel**: Component library - drag components to the canvas.
- **Center Canvas**: Live preview of your page.
- **Right Panel**: Properties for the selected component.

## Components
The editor provides a library of pre-built components:
- **Hero**: Large banner with headline and CTA.
- **Feature Grid**: Display key benefits in a grid layout.
- **Testimonial**: Show social proof from customers.
- **Call to Action**: Drive conversion with focused buttons.
- **Pricing**: Compare plans with feature tables.
- **FAQ**: Accordion-style Q&A sections.
- **Media**: Images, videos, and galleries.
- **Rich Text**: Free-form content blocks.

## Mobile Preview
Always test responsiveness before publishing:
1.  Click the **device icons** in the editor toolbar.
2.  Toggle between Desktop, Tablet, and Mobile views.
3.  Check that content reflows properly on smaller screens.

## Publishing
Changes made in the editor are saved as "Draft". To make them live:
1.  Click **Save** in the top right.
2.  Click **Publish** to push changes to the production site.

> [!NOTE]
> Always preview your changes on different device sizes using the responsive toggle in the editor toolbar.

title: OAuth & BYOK Setup Guide
content:
# OAuth & Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) Setup

## Overview
BasaltCMS allows you to connect your own email providers (Gmail, Outlook) and AI models (OpenAI, Anthropic) using a "Bring Your Own Key" architecture.

## AI Model Configuration
1.  Go to **Settings > AI Agent**.
2.  Select your provider (e.g., OpenAI).
3.  Enter your **API Key** in the secure field.
4.  Click **Verify & Save**.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Your API keys are encrypted at rest using AES-256. We never share your keys with third parties.

title: Vendor Onboarding SOP
content:
# Vendor Onboarding SOP

## Purpose
This SOP outlines the standard procedure for onboarding a new vendor into BasaltCMS using the VCMS tools.

## Pre-requisites
- You must have a digital image of the vendor's business card OR a W9 form.

## Process

### 1. Vendor Scanning
1.  Go to **CMS > Media Library**.
2.  Click the **"Vendors"** tab in the top right.
3.  Click **"Scan Card"** (or drop the image file).
4.  The AI will process the image for approx. 5-10 seconds.
5.  Once complete, a new profile is created in **CMS > Vendors**.

### 2. Validation & Review
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Vendors**.
2.  Locate the new vendor (likely marked `AMBIGUOUS`).
3.  Click to open the profile.
4.  Verify the extracted data against the original card:
    - Spelling of Name/Company
    - Phone Number format
    - Email Address
5.  If correct, change status to **VALIDATED**.

### 3. Document Collection
1.  In the Vendor Profile, go to the **Documents** tab.
2.  Upload any required compliance docs (COI, Insurance).
3.  The **Compliance Score** will update automatically based on valid documents.

title: Connecting Third-Party Apps
content:
# Connecting Third-Party Apps

## Overview
The **Apps & Plugins** system allows you to connect external platforms (like Shopify, WooCommerce, and WordPress) directly to your CMS. This enables a "Headless" content strategy where you manage all content in BasaltCMS and push it to your various storefronts and sites.

## How to Connect an App

1.  **Navigate to Apps Store**
    - Go to **CMS > System > Apps & Plugins**.
    - You will see integrations organized into tabs: E-Commerce, Base Broadcast, Publishing, Utility.

2.  **Select a Provider**
    - **Shopify**: Click "Connect". Enter your store URL (e.g., `mystore.myshopify.com`). Approve the OAuth connection.
    - **WooCommerce**: Click "Connect". Provide Store URL, Consumer Key, and Consumer Secret.
    - **WordPress**: Click "Connect". Enter your WordPress URL and Application Password (Settings > Security > Application Passwords).

3.  **Verification**
    - Once connected, the status indicator turns **Green (Connected)**.
    - You can now use this connection in the Content Editor to distribute posts.

## WordPress Integration
WordPress has a dedicated **Command Center** for advanced features:
1.  Connect via Apps & Plugins.
2.  Access via **My WP Site** in the sidebar or Landing Pages submenu.
3.  Use the Command Center to import/export posts, pages, and media.

## Base Broadcast
Distribute content to decentralized social networks:
- **Farcaster**: Post to Warpcast and other Farcaster clients.
- **Lens Protocol**: Publish to Lens-compatible apps.
- Configure API keys in the Broadcast tab.

## Security Note
All API keys and tokens are encrypted using AES-256 before being stored in our database. We strictly log all access and usage of these credentials for your security audit trails.

title: Blog Content Management SOP
content:
# Blog Content Management SOP

## Purpose
This SOP outlines the standard procedure for creating, editing, and publishing blog posts in BasaltCMS.

## Creating a New Blog Post

### Step 1: Access Blog Module
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Blog** in the sidebar.
2.  Click **Create New +** button.

### Step 2: Fill in Post Details
- **Title**: Enter a compelling, SEO-friendly headline.
- **Slug**: Auto-generated from title, or customize for SEO.
- **Category**: Select or create a category.
- **Excerpt**: Write a brief summary (2-3 sentences) for previews.
- **Content**: Write your full article (Markdown supported).

### Step 3: Add Cover Image
Choose one method:
1.  **Media Library**: Click the image icon and select from existing uploads.
2.  **Nano Banana AI**: Click **Generate** to create a custom AI image.
3.  **Upload New**: Drag and drop a new image.

## AI-Assisted Writing

### Generate Content
1.  Click the **Sparkles** icon.
2.  Select **Create** mode.
3.  Describe your topic (e.g., "Write an article about cloud security best practices").
4.  AI generates a complete draft.
5.  Review and edit as needed.

### Revise Content
1.  Select existing text.
2.  Click **Sparkles** > **Revise**.
3.  Provide instructions (e.g., "Make this more conversational").
4.  AI rewrites the selected section.

## Publishing Workflow

### Save as Draft
Click **Save** to store progress without publishing.

### Publish
1.  Review all fields are complete.
2.  Click **Publish**.
3.  The post is now live on your public blog.

> [!NOTE]
> Always preview your post before publishing to check formatting and images.

title: Landing Page Creation SOP
content:
# Landing Page Creation SOP

## Purpose
This SOP covers the process of creating marketing landing pages using the Puck visual editor.

## Getting Started

### Step 1: Create New Page
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Landing Pages**.
2.  Click **Create Page**.
3.  Choose a template or start blank.
4.  Enter page title and URL slug.

### Step 2: Open Visual Editor
1.  Click **Edit Visual** to launch Puck.
2.  The editor opens with three panels:
    - **Left**: Component library
    - **Center**: Live canvas
    - **Right**: Component properties

## Building Your Page

### Adding Components
1.  Drag a component from the left panel.
2.  Drop it onto the canvas.
3.  Click to select and configure properties.

### Recommended Structure
1.  **Hero**: Start with a compelling headline.
2.  **Features**: Highlight key benefits.
3.  **Social Proof**: Add testimonials.
4.  **CTA**: Close with a strong call-to-action.

### Component Configuration
1.  Select a component on the canvas.
2.  Use the right panel to edit:
    - Text content
    - Colors and styling
    - Images and media
    - Button links

## Responsive Design

### Preview Devices
1.  Click device icons in the toolbar.
2.  Check Desktop, Tablet, Mobile views.
3.  Ensure all content is readable.

### Common Issues
- Text too small on mobile: Increase font size.
- Images overflow: Set max-width constraints.
- Buttons too close: Add padding/margins.

## Publishing

### Save Draft
Click **Save** to store changes without publishing.

### Publish
1.  Verify all components are complete.
2.  Check responsive preview.
3.  Click **Publish**.

### WordPress Sync (Optional)
If connected, use **Sync to WordPress** to push the page.

title: WordPress Sync Workflow
content:
# WordPress Sync Workflow

## Purpose
This SOP covers synchronizing content between BasaltCMS and your WordPress site.

## Prerequisites
- WordPress site with REST API enabled.
- WordPress Application Password generated.
- App connected via **Apps & Plugins > WordPress**.

## Accessing the Command Center

1.  Navigate to **Apps & Plugins > WordPress** (or use the sidebar shortcut **My WP Site**).
2.  The Command Center shows connection status and content tabs.

## Importing from WordPress

### Import Posts
1.  Go to the **Posts** tab.
2.  View all WordPress posts.
3.  Click **Import** on individual posts, or use **Import All**.
4.  Posts appear in your CMS Blog module.

### Import Pages
1.  Go to the **Pages** tab.
2.  Select pages to import.
3.  Pages are converted to Landing Pages with Puck blocks.

### Import Media
1.  Go to the **Media** tab.
2.  Select images to import.
3.  Media appears in your Media Library under **WordPress** tab.

## Exporting to WordPress

### Push Landing Pages
1.  Open a Landing Page in the CMS.
2.  Click **Sync to WordPress**.
3.  Choose to create new or update existing page.

### Push Blog Posts
1.  Open a Blog post.
2.  Use the **Sync** option in the toolbar.
3.  Select target WordPress category.

## Import by URL

1.  In the Command Center, use the **Import URL** field.
2.  Paste any WordPress page URL.
3.  Click **Import**.
4.  The page is fetched and converted to CMS format.

## Troubleshooting

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Connection failed | Verify Application Password is correct |
| Import stuck | Check WordPress REST API is accessible |
| Content missing | Some plugins may block REST API |
| Images broken | Ensure media URLs are public |

title: Newsletter Campaign SOP
content:
# Newsletter Campaign SOP

## Purpose
This SOP outlines the process for creating and sending newsletter campaigns to subscribers.

## Accessing Newsletter

1.  Navigate to **CMS > Subscriptions**.
2.  Click the **Newsletter** tab.

## Managing Subscribers

### View Subscribers
1.  Go to the **Clients** tab.
2.  View all subscribers with signup dates.
3.  Filter by status or segment.

### Add Subscribers
1.  Click **Add Client**.
2.  Enter email and optional details.
3.  Set subscription status.

### Import Subscribers
1.  Prepare a CSV file with email addresses.
2.  Click **Import CSV**.
3.  Map columns to fields.
4.  Confirm import.

## Creating a Campaign

### Step 1: New Campaign
1.  In Newsletter tab, click **Create Campaign**.
2.  Enter campaign name (internal reference).

### Step 2: Configure Email
- **Subject Line**: Craft a compelling subject.
- **Preview Text**: Text shown in inbox previews.
- **From Name**: Sender display name.
- **Reply-To**: Email for responses.

### Step 3: Write Content
1.  Use the rich text editor.
2.  Add headings, paragraphs, images.
3.  Include clear call-to-action buttons.
4.  Use merge tags for personalization (e.g., {{firstName}}).

### Step 4: Select Recipients
1.  Choose **All Subscribers** or a specific segment.
2.  Review estimated recipient count.

## Sending

### Test Send
1.  Click **Send Test**.
2.  Enter your email.
3.  Review the test email.

### Schedule
1.  Click **Schedule**.
2.  Select date and time.
3.  Confirm scheduling.

### Send Now
1.  Click **Send Now**.
2.  Confirm the send.
3.  Monitor delivery status.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Always send a test email before sending to your full list.

title: FAQ Management SOP
content:
# FAQ Management SOP

## Purpose
This SOP covers creating and organizing FAQ content for your public website.

## Accessing FAQ Manager

1.  Navigate to **CMS > FAQ Manager** in the sidebar.
2.  View existing FAQs grouped by category.

## Creating FAQs

### Add New FAQ
1.  Click **Create New +**.
2.  Fill in the form:
    - **Question**: The FAQ question as users would ask it.
    - **Answer**: Comprehensive response (Markdown supported).
    - **Category**: Select existing or create new.
    - **Order**: Set display order within category.

### AI Assistance
1.  Click the **Sparkles** icon.
2.  Choose an option:
    - **Generate**: Describe a topic to create FAQ suggestions.
    - **Expand**: Turn brief answers into comprehensive responses.
    - **Rephrase**: Improve question clarity.

## Organizing FAQs

### Categories
Group related FAQs for easier navigation:
- **General**: About your company/product.
- **Billing**: Payment and pricing questions.
- **Technical**: Usage and troubleshooting.
- **Shipping**: Delivery and returns (if applicable).
- **Custom**: Create your own categories.

### Ordering
1.  Use the **Order** field to set position.
2.  Lower numbers appear first.
3.  FAQs with same order sort alphabetically.

### Drag and Drop
1.  In list view, drag FAQs to reorder.
2.  Order updates automatically.

## Publishing

### Active/Inactive
- **Active**: FAQ appears on public page.
- **Inactive**: FAQ is hidden but saved.

### Embedding in Landing Pages
1.  Edit a Landing Page in Puck.
2.  Add the **FAQ** component.
3.  Select which categories to display.
4.  Configure styling options.

## Best Practices

- Write questions from the user's perspective.
- Keep answers concise but complete.
- Use formatting (bullets, bold) for readability.
- Review and update FAQs regularly.
- Monitor which FAQs get most views.

title: Career Posting SOP
content:
# Career Posting SOP

## Purpose
This SOP outlines the process for creating job listings and managing applications in BasaltCMS.

## Accessing Careers Module

1.  Navigate to **CMS > Careers** in the sidebar.
2.  View existing job postings in grid or list view.

## Creating a Job Posting

### Step 1: New Posting
1.  Click **Create New +**.
2.  The job editor opens.

### Step 2: Fill in Details
- **Title**: Job position name (e.g., "Senior Software Engineer").
- **Department**: Team or department (e.g., Engineering, Marketing).
- **Location**: Office location or "Remote".
- **Type**: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Internship.
- **Summary**: Brief description for listings (2-3 sentences).
- **Content**: Full job description with:
  - Role overview
  - Responsibilities
  - Benefits
- **Requirements**: Skills and qualifications needed.
- **Apply Link**: External application URL or form link.

### Step 3: Add Cover Image
1.  Click the image area.
2.  Choose from:
    - **Media Library**: Select existing image.
    - **Nano Banana**: Generate AI image.
    - **Upload**: Add new image.

## AI-Assisted Content

### Generate Job Posting
1.  Click the **Sparkles** icon.
2.  Select **Create**.
3.  Describe the role (e.g., "Full-stack developer for fintech startup").
4.  AI generates complete job posting.
5.  Review and customize.

### Revise Content
1.  Select text to improve.
2.  Click **Sparkles > Revise**.
3.  Provide instructions.
4.  AI rewrites the section.

## Publishing

### Active Status
- **Active**: Job appears on careers page.
- **Inactive**: Job is hidden but saved.

### Toggle Status
1.  Use the toggle switch on the job card.
2.  Or edit the job and change status.

## Managing Applications

### View Applications
1.  Click the **Applications** tab.
2.  Filter by job posting.
3.  View applicant details.

### Application Status
Track candidates through stages:
- New
- Reviewed
- Interview
- Offer
- Hired / Rejected

title: Media Library Best Practices
content:
# Media Library Best Practices

## Purpose
This guide covers best practices for organizing and optimizing media assets in BasaltCMS.

## Tab Organization

### My Files
Use for personal drafts and work-in-progress assets.
- Not visible to other team members.
- Good for testing before sharing.

### Public Assets
Use for shared team resources.
- Company logos and brand assets.
- Stock images for common use.
- Templates and frequently used graphics.

### Page Assets
Automatically populated when uploading via Puck editor.
- Helps find assets associated with specific pages.
- Keep page-specific images here.

### WordPress
Contains imported WordPress media.
- Maintains original metadata.
- Use for reference during migration.

## File Naming Conventions

### Recommended Format
`[category]-[description]-[size].extension`

### Examples
- `hero-homepage-banner-1920x600.jpg`
- `icon-checkmark-green-64x64.png`
- `team-sarah-profile-400x400.jpg`

### Avoid
- Spaces in filenames (use hyphens).
- Special characters.
- Generic names like "image1.jpg".

## Image Optimization

### File Size
- Keep images under 500KB when possible.
- Use WebP format for best compression.
- Compress before uploading.

### Dimensions
- **Hero images**: 1920px wide maximum.
- **Blog covers**: 1200x630px (OG image ratio).
- **Thumbnails**: 400x400px or smaller.
- **Icons**: 64x64px or 128x128px.

## SEO Optimization

### AI SEO Generation
1.  Select an image.
2.  Click the **Sparkles** icon.
3.  AI generates:
    - **Alt Text**: Description for accessibility.
    - **Title**: SEO-friendly title.
    - **Caption**: Display caption.
    - **Description**: Detailed description.

### Manual SEO
1.  Click an image to open details.
2.  Fill in metadata fields.
3.  Click **Save**.

### Best Practices
- Always add alt text for accessibility.
- Use descriptive titles with keywords.
- Include relevant captions for context.

## Vendor Card Scanning

### Process
1.  Switch to the **Vendors** tab.
2.  Click **Scan Card**.
3.  Upload front (and optionally back) of business card.
4.  AI extracts contact information.
5.  Review and create vendor profile.

## File Management

### Bulk Operations
- Select multiple files with checkboxes.
- Delete or move in bulk.

### Copy URL
- Click the copy icon to get the public URL.
- Use in external tools or embed codes.

title: Analytics Interpretation Guide
content:
# Analytics Interpretation Guide

## Purpose
This guide helps you understand and use the analytics data in BasaltCMS to improve your content strategy.

## Accessing Analytics

### Full Dashboard
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Analytics** in the sidebar.
2.  View comprehensive metrics and charts.

### Quick View Modal
1.  In the Blog list, click the chart icon on any post.
2.  See post-specific analytics in a modal.

## Understanding Metrics

### Total Clicks
**What it measures**: Number of times users clicked on your blog posts.

**Why it matters**: Indicates content discoverability and headline effectiveness.

**How to improve**:
- Write compelling headlines.
- Use eye-catching cover images.
- Optimize meta descriptions.

### Total Shares
**What it measures**: Number of times content was shared via social buttons.

**Why it matters**: Shows content resonance and viral potential.

**How to improve**:
- Create shareable, valuable content.
- Include clear share CTAs.
- Write for emotional engagement.

### Posts with Events
**What it measures**: Number of posts that have recorded engagement data.

**Why it matters**: Shows which posts are actively engaging users.

**Action**: Focus on replicating successful post formats.

## Reading the Charts

### Time Series Chart
- **X-axis**: Date range.
- **Y-axis**: Event count.
- **Lines**: Separate trends for clicks and shares.

**Look for**:
- Spikes: What content was published?
- Dips: Were there any issues?
- Trends: Is engagement growing over time?

### Top Posts Table
Ranked by total engagement (clicks + shares).

**Use for**:
- Identifying best-performing content.
- Understanding what topics resonate.
- Planning future content strategy.

## Using Data for Strategy

### Content Planning
1.  Review top-performing posts.
2.  Identify common themes or formats.
3.  Create similar content.

### Topic Selection
1.  Check which categories perform best.
2.  Double down on high-engagement topics.
3.  Test new topics in small batches.

### Timing Optimization
1.  Look for patterns in engagement spikes.
2.  Identify best days/times for publishing.
3.  Schedule posts accordingly.

## Restore Defaults

If the dashboard shows unexpected data:
1.  Click **Restore Defaults**.
2.  Confirm to reset view settings.
3.  Filters and date ranges reset.
4.  Underlying data is not affected.
